There are Slight spoilers mainly for character analysis. 
Plot 
The premise of handshakers is nothing new to the anime world. Anime's featuring characters that have some kind of power are one of the most common type of genres within the anime world. From the outside this anime can be said to be anything but special but what drew me to Hand shakers was the concept behind it and its story. 
Hand shakers takes place in the city of Osaka sometime in the near future and follows the life of Tazuna Takatsuki a high school student and who whether through fate or something else meets amysterious girl called Koyori. Their meeting which coincided with the touching of their hands transported both to an alternate dimension where they meet the being that resided there where their bonds as hand shakers are forged and their powers are born.  


The overall plot of the series story revolves around the use of the powers called Nimrods that Tazuna and the mysterious girl Koyori gained from their little trip to that dimension and use that to grant their shared wish by beating every other pair that too have their own powers that are derived from their bonds with each other. As the nimrods are born from their shared bonds with each other  the bond that Tazuna and Koyori forge and improve as the series goes is one of the main themes of this story. 



Tazuna 


Tazuna played by veteran voice actor Soma Saito is one of the main characters of the series and is the main hero of the series. A kind and caring person that’s also honest to a fault Tazuna is the image of a standard Japanese teenager. A high school student that has a knack for mechanics and repairs Tazuna loves to repair stuff whether it’s a simple thing like a MP3 player to a car he can with enough time be able to determine what’s wrong with it. As a result of this talent of his however Tazuna has more focus than most people but this is offset by the fact that this trait also makes him unaware of whats happening around him. In the beginning of the series Tazuna thanks to an errand encounters the series main heroine Koyori who lies unconscious in a room that Tazuna encountered upon. A mere touch of her hand eventually resulted in Tazuna and Koyori becoming Hand shakers after encountering the being that resided in that space. 


In the beginning Tazuna did not believe much in the role of a handshaker and wanted his life to remain the way it is. Additionally, because Tazuna has a personality that can be best be described as non-violent Tazuna in the early battles wanted to avoid combat at all costs. However, as the series progresses and he is made aware of the consequences for not just him but also for Koyori of not winning this contest his attitude starts to change. Tazuna starts to fight hard yet at the same time fight smartly. While being kind and caring towards not just his friends and classmates but also to Koyori, Tazuna is also quick thinking and can easily see the different situations that can arise when in combat. This quick thinking also allows him to sometimes come up with tactics that others haven’t accounted for during battles with other handshakers which had the effect of making some of their fights interesting. In combat Tazuna’s Nimrod takes the form of a large number of gears that can either be forged into either a sword for offence or a shield of gears for defense. Generally, his tactics are a mix of defensive strategies mixed with precise strikes on the enemy’s weaknesses. 


Tazuna’s bond with Koyori is one of the main points of the story for this anime and can be said to be one of the central points. At first Tazuna’s relationship with Koyori can be termed as awkward because due to the fact that they have to hold hands as per their bond both to maintain their powers and also to keep Koyori alive.  This inevitably causes problems both at home and at school. At first Tazuna’s first impression of Koyori was that she was a beautiful if silent girl that seemed to have a past that she didn’t know about. As the series progresses however and Tazuna’s bond with Koyori grows in power Tazuna begins to understand Koyori more as she learns new things and learn about the things that are in this new world of hers. As their bond increases which also gives them more power their relationship becomes closer as they come to care about each other more. This however had the effect of Tazuna becoming more protective of her which I thought was nice to see. 


The character of Tazuna I though was an interesting character. While he may look like an average teenager the evolution from a reluctant combatant to one that not only fights well but also smartly while trying to grant the wish to his beloved was nice to see. Soma Saito I felt did a pretty good job here. 


Koyori 


Koyori played by veteran seiyuu Sumire Morohoshi of Bungou stray dogs fame is one of the main characters of the series and is the main heroine of this anime. A mysterious girl that Tazuna stumbles upon while exploring a lab that he had been summoned to Koyori is in fact a hand shaker who had lost her partner in the past. By inadvertently touching her hands with his a bond between the two of them is established and both become hand shakers. Personality wise Koyori has two different personalities that is developed as the series goes on. Koyori’s initial personality which lasted from the time she woke up and right up to she gained her own nimrod was very timid and she seemed to be reluctant to fight very much like Tazuna. At this stage, she was also very quiet and had problems interacting with others partly from the fact that she didn’t trust people that easily. However, as the series goes on Koyori’s personality changes as she fights more with Tazuna and her understanding of him improves which also had the effect of improving their bond as well. As a result of this Koyori becomes more trusting of others, more willing to express her own thoughts and more honest with her feelings towards Tazuna. At first Koyori didn’t actually speak and usually communicated with gestures or facial expressions. This made it hard for Tazuna in the beginning to figure out what she wanted at times. However after gaining her voice back during one of the later battles Koyori was able to express her emotions and feelings much better. Throughout the series we can see that the bond that Koyori shares with Tazuna is important to her because in addition to keeping her alive it also allows them to improve the power that they have as the bond is directly affected by the trust they have with each other. While trust is important ultimately, it’s the feelings that Koyori and Tazuna have for each other that actually makes them more powerful as they fight more battles and overcome the increasingly heavy odds that are laid against them. The love story between them I felt was well done and flowed pretty naturally. 

All in all, I thought that the character of Koyori was pretty well designed and that her seiyuu Sumire Morohoshi really did a great job portraying her. 


Chizuru and Hayate 

Chizuru Mitsudera played by veteran seiyuu Sumire Uesaka of Myriad colors phantom world fame and Hayate Azuma played by veteran voice actor Kaito Ishikawa of Occultic nine fame are fellow handshakers that Tazuna and Koyori encounter as they embark on their quest and are the second pair that they face. Chizuru and Hayate are actually adults that run their own company that deals with new technology that are being leased to places like schools. In this regard Chizuru is the boss of the company while Hayate is the subordinate. Personality wise these two though they have a close relationship as both friends and confidants have different personalities that often clash with each other which is used for comical effect in the series. Chizuru is a serious but cheerful young woman that’s very capable and efficient at her job. Her most notable trait is that of her height which is short to the point that she’s often mistaken for a child much to her chagrin. In the comical arguments that often erupt between her and Hayate Chizuru often makes witty comebacks to Hayate’s comments which is usually pretty funny. 


Hayate Azuma is Chizuru’s partner and also co-worker and helps manage the day to day affairs of the company while also accompanying his boss for business meetings. Compared to Chizuru’s serious and hardworking nature Hayate’s personality is the complete opposite in that he has a more laid-back personality and generally is pretty easy going. Due to his tall height and the fact that he can stand both tall and straight Hayate is often mistaken by others to be the actual boss of the company with Chizuru if she’s present being often mistaken as the new girl instead. This is used for comical effect during the series and it’s always something that’s amusing to see. 


As with all handshakers Chizuru and Hayate have their own wishes that they wish fulfilled once they manage to beat all the other handshakers. This wish was a result of the injustice and the way that they were treated when they first came into the world of the adult working world. I felt that their wish was actually a pretty worthy one and one that I wouldn’t mind seeing. All in all, I felt that the characters of Chizuru and Hayate were well designed characters that contrasted greatly with the first pair in that they had a decent reason and motivation to fight for. I felt that Sumire Uesaka and Kaito Ishikawa did an excellent job portraying their respective characters here.  Of all the pairs that fought in the series Chizuru and Hayate are after Tazuna and Koyori probably one of my favourite characters as their interactions with each other are just hilariously funny. 


Riri and Masaru 


Riri Houjou voiced by veteran seiyuu Ai Kayano of Tales of Zestiria the x and Anohana fame and Masaru Houjou voiced by veteran voice actor Ayumu Murase of elDLIVE fame are fellow handshakers of Tazuna and Koyori that they encounter on their quest and is the third pair of hand shakers that they face. Riri is both the student council president of the school that Tazuna attends and a classmate of his and as a result is someone that Tazuna knows very well. Riri who likes to be called Lily for some reason has a cheerful personality and one that is best described as a big sister type personality commonly seen in anime. When in school and in student council president mode Riri is calm, cheerful and confident and composed however this personality of hers change when she’s with her younger brother who she adores and dots on. Riri has a rather unique hobby which is that of divination in which she makes of use of tarot card reading to determine the fortune of someone. Like Tazuna Riri is someone that dislikes violence yet she and her brother like every other hand shaker has their own wish that they wish fulfilled and as such even if they have to face someone that they know neither will step back as both want to achieve their wishes. 


Masaru is the younger brother of Riri and is a 12-year-old boy who has a talent for card games. Personality wise Masaru is a calm, collected and mature person who despite the age difference actually looks out for his sister even though it should be the other way around. Masaru can be quiet and slow to trust people especially strangers but he’s the type of person that will open up to someone once that person has proven he’s not anyone dangerous or untrustworthy. Masaru’s talents for card games is not just a hobby that he takes part in for the fun of it though and instead forms a part of his Nimrod as well.  Though not as developed as pairs like Kodama and Hibiki and Chizuru and Hayate the pair of Riri and Masaru are still pretty interesting characters with much of this coming from Riri’s interactions with her brother and the fact that she’s always being embarrassed by him. I felt that Ai Kayano and Ayumu Murase really did a good job portraying their respective characters. Being able to use his hobby as his nimrod though was an interesting design decision on the part of the writers here. 


Kodama and Hibiki 


Kodama voiced by veteran seiyuu Mikako Komatsu of Re Creators and Tales of Zestiria the x fame and Hibiki Moriyama voiced by veteran voice actor Tomokazu Sugita of Kanon and Buddy complex fame are fellow hand shakers that Tazuna and Koyori encounter as part of their trials. Kodama is a popular idol singer that is recognized by her fans for her use of prominent proverbs from famous people as well as her singing ability. Personality wise Kodama is a cheerful, positive and self-assured person that can be overconfident at times. Though not underestimating any of her enemies Kodama can however be smug at her opponents Kodama has real skill in combat as in the story she was able to hold her own against every one that challenged her. Kodama’s fighting style is very different to what the other handshakers make use of as part of their fighting techniques in that Kodama’s are more akin to being at a concert as her moves while certainly hard-hitting look like the finely tuned dance routines that are seen at concerts. Due to her experience Kodama and Hibiki can be said to be the first real challenges that Tazuna and Koyori have to face in their journey. Kodama’s most prominent trait is probably her use of famous proverbs that she often uses whether in battle or outside of it. 


Hibiki is the manager of Kodama and also a handshaker whose main role is to support her. Though in the support role Hibiki isn’t a pushover in a fight as he is very much capable of launching some rather strong attacks that can be surprising given his role. Personality wise Hibiki is calm, polite and positive and even during combat tends to stay focused for his role of support for Kodama. The relationship between the two is very much like that of a manager and idol in that Hibiki helps manage the activities of Kodama while also helping to both support her in battle and to motivate her both in and out of it. From this it can be seen that apart from being a manager and performer Kodama and Hibiki are also really good friends from their actions as handshakers and also from the past memories that were shown in the series. As with all handshakers the power of a handshaker was gained by Kodama and Hibiki thanks to the hardships and challenges that both experienced. In this case the challenges came from being looked down and disregarded by both their fans and the companies that managed them despite the hard work that both have done. As a result of this injustice that also serves as the team’s main motivator Kodama and Hibiki can be said to be fighting the hardest to achieve victory in order to enter the other dimension and have their wish granted. 


The character of Kodama I felt was actually pretty done and designed as though she appears to be a girl that’s slightly older than Tazuna and Koyori the hardships and challenges that she has faced in her career has hardened her so while she still retains her trademark positive and upbeat nature that defines her it can be said that she knows what the reality of life is and how unfair that can be to people. As a result, she can be seen as a good contrast between Tazuna who though as determined as she is doesn’t have the same wealth of experience in life that Kodama has seen. In a way, the fight between the pair is very much a clash of ideas as it is a clash of arms. All in all, I felt that the character of Kodama was an interesting character and that her seiyuu Mikako Komatsu really did an excellent job portraying her. 


Bind and Break 


Bind played by veteran seiyuu singer Yoko Hikasa of the Devil is a part timer and High school DxD fame and Break who is played by veteran voice actor Jun Fukuyama of Code Geass and Rail wars fame are fellow hand shakers of Tazuna and served as the first opponents after Tazuna and Koyori become hand shakers. Though their appearance in the series was relatively brief it can be seen that the relationship that the two had was very different to the other hand shakers that are present in the anime. In their relationship, it can be seen that Break is the master here who makes use of his partner’s ability by tormenting her which I found to be slightly disturbing. His attitude towards her rather than being caring and understanding seems to be the opposite in that he seems to view her as something akin to a tool instead of a human. Despite that it seems that doesn’t seem to bother his partner Bind as she seems to be both close to and devoted to her master. Despite their flaws the pair of bind and break managed to serve their intended purpose in the story by showing Tezuna and Koyori just the types of fights that they will be expected to face now that they have become hand shakers. It also taught them that brawn and might are not the only thing that can lead to a victory as intelligence and tactics are also things that need to be considered which is best shown when Tazuna and Koyori used this to win against them. 


Makihara 

Makihara played by veteran voice actor Shoutaro Morikubo of Naruto fame is one of the main support characters of the series. A scientist that worked at the university that Tazuna visited and where he encountered and met Koyori Makihara is a researcher whose research is focused on what he calls the hand shakers phenomenon. Though Makihara has a serious side to him when he explains new developments that affect both the world and Tazuna and Koyori his default personality is rather laid back and relaxed which often causes him to be disregarded by Tazuna and Koyori at times which is comical every time this happens. Makihara’s main role in the series apart for providing support to Tazuna and Koyori also consists of watching over Koyori who he was charged with monitoring and document the changes to her as her bond with Tazuna improves and advances. A recurring trait of Makihara’s is his rather over the top expressions that he uses when told positive things or being made aware of good things which I found comical. 


Nagaoka and Mayumi 


Daichi Nagaoka voiced by veteran voice actor Kenjiro Tsuda of Attack on Titan fame and his partner Mayumi who is voiced by veteran seiyuu Ai Kakuma of Asterisk wars and Clockwork planet fame are fellow hand shakers that Tazuna and Koyori face near the end of their journey. A mysterious character whose appearance in the plot leaves more questions than answers made even more so by the cryptic comments that he leaves before vanishing. This had the effect of making this character even more mysterious. The reveal of his characters true role in the story and his connection with not just Makihara but also with Koyori’s past was however a well-executed move.  Personality wise Nagaoka is a calm, aloof and analytical person that has a degree of intelligence in him that reminds you of a scientist. Yet this is offset by the fact that Nagaoka seems to have problems conversing with people in that due to his limited social skills he has trouble coming up with smart answers or converse with people that he hasn’t seen for some time. Nagaoka’s main personality trait that defines him however is that he is someone that is extremely driven and determined to achieve his goals to the point where he will use any and all means to do so even if these means are underhanded or evil. 


Mayumi is Nagaoka’s partner and fellow hand shaker and in physical appearance looks very much like Koyori because they are related. Like all hand shaker’s Mayumi is very loyal to her master who in this case is Nagaoka however it can be seen that rather having a bond that is built from mutual trust and genuine feelings their bond seems to be built on something else entirely. Due in part to how Nagaoka helped maintain her life Mayumi has very limited personality besides her loyalty however it can be seen with her attacks that she seems to be rather childlike in that she seems to like playing with toys like balls. However, this doesn’t mean that Mayumi doesn’t have a personality as though she may be quiet she can still speak and from this we can see that while she is obedient to her partner she also has the capability to make her own decisions especially if it clashed with her core duties of protecting her partner.  Mayumi’s other personality that she recovers near the end of the series is slightly different to her other personality that was born of how she was treated by her partner. In this personality though she retains her loyal nature Mayumi is a bit more understanding and talkative and not afraid of embarrassing her partner. This personality I felt also made her look more positive which is different to her other personality which was a bit gloomy. 


Like all handshakers Mayumi and Nagaoka also have their own wishes that they wish to be fulfilled and in this case, it’s to continue the work of Nagaoka’s teacher and Mayumi’s father. The defining trait about Mayumi is that because she has no emotions and no personality she will usually use the more direct methods to settle her fights and in away actually resembles Koyori when she was still in her old self. Mayumi’s nimrod within the series is rather unique in that it takes of the form of a ball that can be used to create countless other balls that can be used to encompass an area where Nagaoka’s attacks can reach. 


Arts and animation 


The art style that was used in this series I felt was pretty good and both the environments that were shown as well as the designs of the individual characters was well designed and implemented. In particular the character design for Koyori and Kodama I though was pretty good. Koyori’s design can aptly  be described as the sleeping beauty as true to her persona she is someone that was created and born into this world a long time ago in the past which meant that there are few girls in this period that can be compared against her. With the persona of Koyori being someone that has been asleep for a long time I thought this design of hers really matched her. Plus, Koyori’s design really made her look really cute. The character design for Kodama was also another one that matched her persona yet one that also emphasized on the fact that idols should be approachable to the people. The resulting design I felt was nicely done and the different shades of colors that she had on her outfit contrasted nicely with each other. Another thing that was noticed in regard to the animation is how clear everything is especially when they show the city scenes. The details that are present in these scenes was nicely done.  With regards to the combat scenes I thought that they were well done and clear enough in that we as the viewer were able to see clearly what was going on in the battle itself. The animation of individual characters and scenes I felt were also well done. 


Music 


The opening theme for the series I felt was pretty good and helped set the mood for the series while also having a good tempo. The music for individual scenes within the series was well done and felt appropriate for the scenes that it was used in. The ending theme for the series however is different to the opening theme in that it seems to be more focused on Koyori and her struggles in life and as a result has a rather somber tone to it compared to the upbeat nature of the opening theme. However, I do like the contrast between the two though and I can clearly see what the intended effect the animator clearly intended with their choices. 


Voice acting 


Voice acting for the series I thought was actually pretty good which is helped by the fact that almost every cast member that was in this series is a veteran with many roles to their name. In particular the seiyuu’s for the characters of Koyori, Chizuru and Kodama which are Sumire Morohoshi, Sumire Uesaka and Mikako Komatsu I felt did an excellent job portraying their respective characters. Sumire Morohoshi in particular is a seiyuu that I only seen in support roles until now most recently in Bungou stray dogs. The line that divides a support role and separates that from a main role is a large hurdle and challenge yet it’s nice to see Sumire was able to handle the job of portraying Koyori who is not the easiest character to play. Overall the voice acting for the series was pretty strong which helped make the characters that they portray more lifelike. 


Overall conclusion 


In conclusion Handshakers was an anime series that I really enjoyed watching when it first came on during the first anime period. To me the strong points of this anime was the overall concept, story, characters and the voice acting. 


 Although the overall concept of people gaining powers is not a genre that is particularly new in anime the concept and variation of it that was used in this anime I thought was interesting and well designed. The idea to make use of a bond that two people have created and share with each other as the main form of power within the series rather than the usual single person power was an interesting concept and a gamble as was the promise that by managing to defeat every other pair that have similar powers you will be able to enter the other world and have your wish granted by the god there. Ultimately this gamble did pay off and because this bond will get more powerful the closer one is to their partner it also provides a good means to affect some good development of the individual characters. The wishes part of the bond I felt was well thought out as each of the characters that were featured in the series though having different personalities all have one thing that they have in common with each other which is the wish that they would like the god in the other world to grant. Each of the characters no matter how positive they may be have had horrible things happen to them in the past that had the effect of creating the bonds with someone that share their pain and thus giving them the means to become hand shakers. Because each of these wishes are a result of the hardships that each character faces they are directly connected with the personalities of each character and can be said to be unique to each. Naturally as a fighting type anime the bond that the characters share with their partners directly affect how powerful they are as hand shakers with them becoming more powerful as they trust their partner more. 


The overall story of the series revolves around Tazuna and Koyori’s journey to both discover the truth of Koyori herself as well as get to the other dimension to see the god there and have their wish granted by defeating every other pair if hand shakers that share their goals. Arguably the most important aspect of the story was Tazuna and Koyori’s meetings with the various hand shaker pairs that though their enemies at first quickly become allies once defeated. It is through each of their personal stories and wishes that one can see and understand the motivations for them becoming hand shakers. An important part of the overall story for the series is of course the bond that is forged between Tazuna and Koyori and its improvements as the series goes on. Though they had the most unusual of first encounters watching them get to know each other and see their bonds develop as they both find the motivation that they need for their quest was heart-warming. As was seeing them put the new powers that they gained from this bond to good use. Koyori’s past forms a part of the main story for the series but isn’t addressed until near the end of the series. This part of the plot I felt was actually pretty good and helped in explaining how she was created and the hardships that she went through that ultimately caused her to be put to sleep by Makihara. 


The combination of an interesting concept, interesting story and reinforced by a talented voice cast and great characters made Hand shakers one of the better anime that I saw back in the first period. Though some of the characters I felt could have used some more development I felt that the series as it stands is an interesting one.

LA started seeing repetitive "stock footage" previously shown in earlier episodes which also dampened the animation quality though LA does exactly think this one is something to rage about as LA was more annoyed and placed under headaching inducing moments with it's ambitious animation style more. LA "gets" it, Hand Shakers wanted to do something unique but was slightly too ambitious and wanted EVERY animation idea on the plate, instead of making a more cohesive animation style it just felt like a disorientated mess.


In terms of voice acting, felt like it was where there would be some grace here and there and there is thankfully but that only makes the characters they voice all the more troublesome...it's not the voice cast's fault...it's their bland characters. LA will rapidfire all this soooo <LA breathes in>...Soma Saito was ok, Sumire Morohoshi got a VERY easy paycheck by essentially moaning and grunting all her lines and when Koyori FINALLY DOES starts to speak...she's ok at best but LA still has a problem with Koyori as a character and not because of Sumire's acceptably ok vocals, Yoko Hikasa was wasted on, Jun Fukuyama was annoying with him basically shouting all his lines, Ai Kayano and Sumire Uesaka were tolerable at best, Ayumu Murase was ok, Tomokazu Sugita, Shoutaro Morikubo and Mikako Komatsu talked far too much making them very annoying. -sigh- with this good of voice cast.....all LA can say to this is that it's a HUGE wasted potential on this voice cast.


We haven't even gotten to the PLOT of Hand Shakers...well that's easy yet vague as hell enough...the concept of Hand Shakers is like a sanitized version of Mirai Nikki or Fate stay night, with no blood, no killings and with no solid reasoning as to why Hand Shakers are fighting each other (Yes, LA knows that they can get a wish or meet and become god? and everything, but even the wish-granting or meeting and becoming god is extremely vague.) There is one major subplotline what with Tazuna and Koyori's "romantic" relationship but due to it being one-sided on Koyori's part and worse, but there's just no chemistry between Tazuna and Koyori and it just comes out a completely forced and manipulative, from their interactions to them as a fighting duo and LA entirely blame Koyori for this as she just doesn't emote and when she DOES starts emoting and speaking, her personality is as dull and bland as Tazuna is and probably even worse in the romantic standpoint as she only ever thinks and talks about Tazuna...this is our main love relationship people and even at it's best it's just cliche. Koyori maybe the one pushing the romantic relationship but LA still doesn't see the romance side of things as nothing more than the main characters faffing about before the next disorientating battle.


The final arc of Hand Shakers does try to explain Koyori's backstory and the entire backstory to the major villain of Hand Shakers goal in fighting Koyori and Tazuna in all this and it's a grand effort just to explain, something LA greatly wanted after all the faffing about and lulling it did just to get to this point and fine, the final arc did salvage what lackluster plot it had it already had. The ending still didn't fix it's animation flaws to our main leads, Tazuna and Koyori (yes even Koyori's backstory didn't help her own character!, it just gave us more depth to the already blank slate Koyori...but nothing more and even WORSE on Mayumi's part). The final showdown overall had problems with spatial battle orientation due to how Tazuna and Koyori kept changing their battle area...and it ended -sigh- in an anti-climax with a rush character development job on Mayumi as well, ohh and the entire challenging God thing is only said in passing due to the resolution of the major villain in their final showdown with Tazuna and Koyori. Overall, LA felt rather mixed with this ending.


Yes, Hand Shakers, LA is shaking LA's hands....in pure disappointing awe as to what you produced, fine you had the best of intentions, but LA mostly thinks that either you were too ambitious or you had no idea what the hell you were doing!, sure being ambitious is a double-edged sword, where if you put effort and KNOW what your doing, that ambition can bring about a great show, but in LA's eyes, that ambition can be corrupted if you don't know what the hell your doing and your overly ambitious to the point of just throwing everything at the wall and just seeing what sticks. Yes, at the start of this review, LA DID call Hand Shakers a travesty and on an animation standpoint, it's an experimental misguided travesty if to the point of headachy induced nausea, but what really broke the anime for LA was the lackluster and extremely lacking plot AND it's one-dimensional "running gag" characters and even lazier romance to our main protagonists. No, this isn't the worst anime LA seen, but it's one of the worst misguided animation experiments in quite a while...


Icarus tried to fly to the Sun with wax wings and in his hubris fell on melted wings...


Production GoHands tried to make a great anime with Hand Shakers with it's disorientating animation and even lazier plot as it's wings and in Shingo Suzuki's hubris fell into LA's WORST anime of Winter 2017.
